snippet: The International Criminal Court demanded the release of four staff members it said were meeting with the imprisoned son of the deposed dictator Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi.
abstract: International Criminal Court demands the release of four staff members it says are being detained in Libya, where they were meeting with the imprisoned son of the deposed dictator Col Muammar el-Qaddafi; four include at least one lawyer, Melinda Taylor, who the court has assigned to help defend the legal interests of Seif al-Islam el-Qaddafi, who was detained by fighters in November.
lead_paragraph: The International Criminal Court demanded the release of four staff members it said were meeting with the imprisoned son of the deposed dictator Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi.

headline.seo: Libya Detains International Criminal Court Team
headline.main: International Court Team Is Held in Libya
headline.print_headline: International Court Team Is Held in Libya
